definition: lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus

sentences.english: This is the knot, the representative of the national anthem, every year more than the meaning of.
sentences.chinese: 这是中国结，代表吉祥如意，年年有余的意思。

sentences.english: Fish is always part of the dinner because it represents abundance.
sentences.chinese: 鱼总是晚餐必不可少的，因为鱼象征着年年有余。

definition: complimentary remarks/well-wishing
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
moral (of a story)/lesson to be learned/implication/message/import/metaphorical meaning
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
lit. gold and jade fill the hall (idiom)/fig. abundant wealth/abundance of knowledge
the more sons, the more happiness (idiom)
lucky/auspicious/propitious
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
good luck and long life
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
great luck, great profit (idiom); everything is thriving
the dragon and phoenix are symbols of good fortune (idiom)/auspicious/decorated with auspicious symbols such as the dragon and the phoenix
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
long-lived people, rich harvests (idiom); stable and affluent society/prosperity
